claims.claim_text: Quai Director for Africa (Georgy) believes the Soviets maintain their ambitions for expansion in Africa.
Georgy thinks the Soviets are currently taking one step back in Africa to avoid confrontation with the West.
The Soviets stressed the need to "de-dramatize" the African situation.
Georgy reports that the Soviets appeared to value the opportunity to discuss Africa with the French.
The Soviets told Georgy they cannot discuss Africa with other powers.
The Soviets stated that discussions with the US always come back to strategic issues such as SALT.
Georgy thought the Soviets had little real understanding of the complexities and fragility of African affairs.
Georgy surmised that the Soviets were in the process of taking one step back after trying to take two big steps forward and meeting Western resistance.
Georgy said the Soviets appeared to see the Western role in Africa in terms of encirclement of the Soviet Union.
Georgy said the Soviets claimed the US airlift of troops to Shaba was part of a broad NATO strategy.
Georgy believes the Soviets have an important interest in stability in North Africa.
Georgy said the expansion of Soviet ties with Morocco has placed the Soviets in a position where they wish to avoid choosing sides between the Algerians and the Moroccans.
Georgy believes the Soviets would probably "do what was necessary" to make possible a settlement in the Sahara.
Georgy said the Soviets were deeply troubled by Qadhafi because of his adventurism and religious fanaticism.
Georgy noted that the Soviets were particularly angered that Jalloud chose to visit Peking when the Sino-Japanese Peace and Friendship Treaty was signed.
Georgy thought the consultations had been worthwhile.
The cable's author would not be surprised if the consultations were to become a regular feature of Franco-Soviet relations.
Quai Director for Africa (Georgy) returned from two days of intensive consultations in Moscow on Africa, August 9-10.

questions.question_text: What was the assessment of a French official regarding Soviet expansionist goals in Africa?
banned_terms: Soviets maintain their ambitions for expansion in Africa

questions.question_text: According to a French official, what tactical approach were the Soviets employing in Africa to prevent conflict with Western powers?

banned_terms: Soviets stressed the need to "de-dramatize" the African situation

banned_terms: Soviets were in the process of taking one step back after trying to take two big steps forward and meeting Western resistance

banned_terms: Soviets appeared to see the Western role in Africa in terms of encirclement of the Soviet Union

banned_terms: Soviets would probably "do what was necessary" to make possible a settlement in the Sahara

questions.question_text: Where did a French official recently conduct extensive discussions concerning African matters?

How did major powers approach bilateral and multilateral discussions concerning African issues in 1978?
What was the Soviet perception of Western activities and influence in Africa during the late 1970s?
What were the challenges and priorities for Soviet foreign policy in North Africa in 1978?
What was the nature of Franco-Soviet diplomatic engagement on regional security issues in 1978?
